title: SqueakR
text: package allows data necessary visualizations stored single object. However, , experimental object must created. create experiment, run following code: code creates new experiment object, name my_experiment. object saved, saved using name, along timestamp. point, ’s nothing stored experiment object except name, let’s inspect experiment structured: can see str() function experiment object 5 main groups listed : name: name just set experiment last_saved: timestamp last time experiment saved (case, time object created) groups: empty variable show experimental groups animals: empty variable show distinct animal (IDs) tested experimenters: empty variable show experimenters collected data experimental_data: empty list store raw processed data experiment Now experiment created, can start add data .
code: experiment <- create_experiment(experiment_name = "my_experiment") #> Creating new experiment... str(experiment) #> List of 6 #>  $ name             : chr "my_experiment" #>  $ last_saved       : POSIXct[1:1], format: "2022-06-24 16:45:37" #>  $ groups           : NULL #>  $ animals          : NULL #>  $ experimenters    : NULL #>  $ experimental_data: list()

title: SqueakR
text: call data exported DeepSqueak, includes detected calls length recording. However, sometimes, ’re interested calls within certain range entire recording. SqueakR add_timepoint_data() function assist : parameters add_timepoint_data() defined follows: data_path: full path data file t1: timepoint calls start extracted my_new_data object t2: timepoint calls stop extracted object. context code , ’ve just extracted calls 5-25 second region. view data ’ve extracted confirm : inspect Begin Time (s) column first table generated , ’ll notice first observation (row) represents call begins ~5 seconds. Inspecting End Time (s) column second table, last call dataset ends ~24 seconds, indicating ’ve selected 5-25 region calls.
code: my_new_data <- add_timepoint_data(data_path = "../inst/extdata/Example_Mouse_Data.xlsx", t1 = 5, t2 = 25) #> Adding call features Excel file to workspace... #> Restricting data to range: 5 to 25 seconds... # The first few rows of the dataset head(my_new_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 17 #>      ID Label Accepted Score `Begin Time (s)` `End Time (s)` `Call Length (s)` #>   <dbl> <chr> <lgl>    <dbl>            <dbl>          <dbl>             <dbl> #> 1    12 18    TRUE     0.573             5.36           5.38            0.0152 #> 2    13 12    TRUE     0.649             6.35           6.39            0.0403 #> 3    14 26    TRUE     0.931             6.46           6.51            0.0488 #> 4    15 19    TRUE     0.969             6.59           6.66            0.0787 #> 5    16 26    TRUE     0.885             6.73           6.77            0.0460 #> 6    17 9     TRUE     0.808             6.85           6.90            0.0445 #> # … with 10 more variables: `Principal Frequency (kHz)` <dbl>, #> #   `Low Freq (kHz)` <dbl>, `High Freq (kHz)` <dbl>, `Delta Freq (kHz)` <dbl>, #> #   `Frequency Standard Deviation (kHz)` <dbl>, `Slope (kHz/s)` <dbl>, #> # title: SqueakR
text: Since lot data contained object, summary structure. following variables assigned single value: animal: animal (testing group) ID, specified score_timepoint_data() function. id: name original file corresponding dataset, can accessed using unblinding functions discussed later group: experimental group, specified score_timepoint_data() function. experimenter: experimenter collected data, specified score_timepoint_data() function. calls_n: number detected calls following range (automatically calculated) rest variables extracted my_new_data object sub-variables stored : mean, standard_deviation, range: call_length delta_frequency high_frequency low_frequency peak_frequency power principal_frequency sinuosity slope tonality information variables can found DeepSqueak wiki. Finally, raw variable contains entire extracted dataset (my_new_data object), can referenced plotting data. data structure may appear complicated, useful later organize data!

26 (n = 24); 2 (n = 9) and 7 others #>   - Accepted: 1 level, namely TRUE (n = 94) #>   - Score: Mean = 0.78, SD = 0.12, range: [0.51, 0.97] #>   - Begin_Time: Mean = 15.82, SD = 5.43, range: [5.36, 23.81] #>   - End_Time: Mean = 15.87, SD = 5.43, range: [5.38, 23.84] #>   - Call_Length: Mean = 0.04, SD = 0.02, range: [0.02, 0.13] #>   - Principal_Frequency: Mean = 61.87, SD = 3.80, range: [52.40, 68.79] #>   - Low_Freq: Mean = 48.80, SD = 4.54, range: [40.26, 66.21] #>   - High_Freq: Mean = 65.57, SD = 4.11, range: [57.64, 76.81] #>   - Delta_Freq: Mean = 16.77, SD = 5.60, range: [1.11, 31.58] #>   - Frequency_Standard_Deviation: Mean = 4.42, SD = 1.41, range: [0.27, 7.73] #>   - Slope: Mean = 318.38, SD = 200.15, range: [-111.24, 825.64] #>   - Sinuosity: Mean = 1.41, SD = 0.24, range: [1.09, 2.23] #>   - Mean_Power: Mean = -71.89, SD = 5.82, range: [-82.20, -55.35] #>   - Tonality: Mean = 0.46, SD = 0.11, range: [0.27, 0.75] #>   - Peak_Freq: Mean = 62.18, SD = 5.55, range: [49.57, 72.13] #>   - index: Mean = 119.50, SD = 27.28, range: [73, 166] #>  #> - Sham (n = 70): #>   - ID: Mean = 366.50, SD = 20.35, range: [332, 401] #>   - Label: 15 entries, such as 12 (n = 12); title: SqueakR
text: SqueakR also function calculating ANOVA different groups, establishing presence absence least one significant difference groups, can run : can use function justify statistically-significant data:
code: squeakrANOVA(experiment = experiment, analysis_factor = "Delta_Freq") #> Coefficient covariances computed by hccm() #> ANOVA Table (type II tests) #>  #>   Effect DFn DFd     F     p p<.05   ges #> 1  group   2 233 2.266 0.106       0.019 squeakrANOVA(experiment = experiment, analysis_factor = "Call_Length") #> Coefficient covariances computed by hccm() #> ANOVA Table (type II tests) #>  #>   Effect DFn DFd     F     p p<.05   ges #> 1  group   2 233 7.005 0.001     * 0.057

title: SqueakR
text: Finally, SqueakR package features Shiny Dashboard can used explore data conduct analyses groups, well summarize call experiment data, within single R application. primary benefit dashboard exists centralized interface experimenters upload experiments conduct analyses efficiently without using R code (users happen less code inclined). Plots relatively complicated syntax access data can easily graphed dashboard, selecting call dataset interest drop-widget. dashboard launched console using SqueakR function:

title: SqueakR
text: SqueakR developed primary aim streamline bioacoustics data processing experiments processing data automatically — allowing busy experimenters go straight data collection results. end, one future directions project include increasing analytical post-processing capabilities package. Adding uses Report package functions (CRAN GitHub) SqueakR allow processed data connect directly statistical analyses, useful processing DeepSqueak data. suggestions feedback current future directions welcome SqueakR Discussions page!

title: Updates Experiment Object Metadata — update_experiment
text: list object containing statistics metadata entire experiment. `groups`, `experimenters`, `animals` fields auto-populate based added data using `update_experiment()` function.

title: SqueakR 1.2.8
text: Used report package analyses: added functions reporting descriptive statistics grouped data SqueakR Dashboard tab Deprecated SqueakR Dashboard repository GitHub merged functions SqueakR Added 3D cluster plot visualization function plotClusters() call length (z), principal frequency (x) mean power (y) using plotly, available base SqueakR dashboard Added animal field added experiment data, updates experiment metadata animals field. Updated compatibility match semi-automatic automatic SqueakR pipelines, well describe_experiment() function. Updated documentation reflect change Added Plotly sunburst plot (functions list dashboard) graph proportions collected data done per experimenter, well data collected per animal per group Added Plotly surface plot using 2D kernel density estimation represent call density Principal Frequency Call Length. Added functions unblinding experimenters data

title: SqueakR 1.2.8
text: Merged SqueakR dashboard SqueakR package! Dashboard can now run loading package running squeakRDashboard() Added function calculating ANOVA groups Added ANOVA tab SqueakR Dashboard determining statistical significance call features

title: SqueakR 1.2.8
text: Added fully-automatic pipeline function (autosqueakRpipeline()) references Google Sheet add data without experimenter input every file Renamed experiment_pipeline() semisqueakRpipeline() Added function (remove_experiment_data()) remove data experiment object Updated vignette reflect package changes

title: SqueakR 1.2.8
text: Recreated NEWS.md file track changes package. Added functions generating experiment analyzing data experimental groups. Added visualizations including ethnograms, histograms, box-plots, correlation matrices.
